hypothesis_content.title: Asymmetric News Reaction in Neutral Regime
hypothesis_content.statement: During NEUTRAL regimes (confidence 55-70%), negative news catalysts produce price declines 1.8-2.2x larger in magnitude than equivalent-strength positive news catalysts produce gains, over a 6-hour horizon.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes lack strong directional conviction. Negative news triggers 'risk-off' responses more reliably than positive news triggers 'risk-on', due to asymmetric loss aversion and deleveraging impulses. Current 61.5% neutral confidence with bearish news flow provides ideal test environment.
entry_conditions: Binary news event (clearly positive or negative) affecting macro/funding
For negative news: short on confirmed break below pre-news 2h low
For positive news: long on confirmed break above pre-news 2h high

exit_conditions.take_profit: Negative trades: 2.0x the average 6h positive-news reaction magnitude from past 30 days
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price returns to pre-news level (for negative trades) or breaks opposite side of pre-news range

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Positive and negative news reactions show less than 1.3x magnitude difference during neutral regimes over 20+ instances.
